decks.notes: The deck focuses on establishing a strong, hexproof creature with multiple auras attached to it to create a powerful, evasive threat that can quickly defeat the opponent. The key strategy is to protect the hexproof creature from removal spells with auras like Leyline of Sanctity and Unflinching Courage, while boosting its power and resilience with Ethereal Armor, Rancor, and Daybreak Coronet. By quickly building up a powerful attacking creature, the deck can overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to respond.

The main concept of this deck revolves around controlling the game with powerful red spells and disruptive artifacts to limit the opponent's options. By using cards like Blood Moon, Ensnaring Bridge, and Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and then close out the game with big threats like Sarkhan, Fireblood and Chandra, Torch of Defiance. The deck's ramp abilities with cards like Pyretic Ritual and Gemstone Caverns help accelerate its game plan, while removal spells like Abrade and Slagstorm provide additional versatility and control options.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with cheap artifacts and using cards like Steel Overseer and Master of Etherium to pump them up. The key strategy is to equip Cranial Plating onto a creature to deal massive damage, while also having the option to sacrifice artifacts with Arcbound Ravager for additional bonuses. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of aggressive creatures and burn spells like Galvanic Blast to close out the game quickly.

The deck revolves around quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, enabling powerful graveyard interactions such as bringing back Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion help with card selection and filling the graveyard, while Life from the Loam allows for consistent land recursion. The main win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of creatures and burn spells like Conflagrate. The key strategy is to efficiently utilize the graveyard as a resource to generate recurring value and outpace the opponent.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Eldrazi Displacer. The deck also utilizes ramp with Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple to quickly put out threats like Reality Smasher and Drowner of Hope. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck while providing consistency with cards like Ancient Stirrings. Additionally, there is removal in the form of Path to Exile to deal with opposing threats.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Wild Nacatl and Knight of the Reliquary, while also disrupting their game plan with removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt. The deck also utilizes powerful cards like Bloodbraid Elf and Domri Rade to generate additional value and card advantage. By applying early pressure and controlling the board with disruptive spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on maximizing the efficiency and synergy of Human creatures by utilizing cards that support and enhance their abilities. The strategy revolves around quickly deploying a team of aggressive creatures onto the battlefield, using cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch to speed up the process. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage disrupt opponents' game plans, while Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish grow in power as more Humans enter the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a cohesive and fast-paced aggressive strategy.

Using a variety of elves and powerful spells, this deck focuses on creating an overwhelming board presence quickly through the mana generation of elves to cast game-winning spells like Collected Company and Chord of Calling. Key cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies allow for infinite mana combos, while Ezuri, Renegade Leader gives the team trample and a pump effect. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flood of creatures and buffs, utilizing the synergy and versatility of the elf tribe to overpower the opponent swiftly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive play, utilizing burn spells and efficient creatures to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. It aims to control the board and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to press the advantage. The key strategy is to keep up the pressure and force the opponent into a defensive position, ultimately overwhelming them with direct damage.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on mana ramping with Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to quickly cast powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Spell Queller. The deck also utilizes cards like Collected Company and Reflector Mage to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. With a mix of efficient creatures, disruption spells, and land destruction, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays while maintaining tempo and resource advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to effectively use cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells and generate mana through rituals in order to cast a high storm count Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Gifts Ungiven to search for specific combo pieces and cards like Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Tarmogoyf, Street Wraith, and Death's Shadow to quickly establish a powerful board presence and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Stubborn Denial and Thoughtseize allows for disruption of the opponent's strategies, while Traverse the Ulvenwald and Kolaghan's Command provide flexibility and additional utility. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game and capitalize on the opponent's weaknesses, ultimately aiming to close out the game as quickly as possible through aggressive plays and efficient removal.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells like Lightning Helix, Wrath of God, and Anger of the Gods, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nahiri, the Harbinger and Gideon Jura to maintain board control. It has a versatile mana base with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chandra, Torch of Defiance to ramp up to its win condition of either ultimating Nahiri to fetch Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, or locking opponents out with Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon.	Field of Ruin and Cast Out provide additional utility and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach to cheat out big creatures like Griselbrand and Worldspine Wurm from the graveyard or hand, while also using Nourishing Shoal for life gain and protection. The deck aims to set up explosive plays by combining instant reanimation effects with powerful combo pieces, allowing for quick victories in a Modern 1 vs 1 match. Other cards like Faithless Looting and Tormenting Voice help to dig through the deck and find crucial combo pieces, while also providing card advantage and filtering.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through creatures, discard them into the graveyard, and then cast Living End to return all creatures to the battlefield from the graveyard. This combo can be achieved early in the game using cards like Street Wraith, Simian Spirit Guide, and Violent Outburst, overwhelming opponents with a sudden swarm of powerful creatures. Additionally, cards like Faerie Macabre and Archfiend of Ifnir provide disruption and control options to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies.

The main concept of this UR Control deck is to maintain control of the game through disruption spells like Remand, Cryptic Command, and Spell Snare, while also having versatile removal options in Lightning Bolt, Abrade, and Electrolyze. The deck aims to transition into a win condition by flipping Thing in the Ice or utilizing Snapcaster Mage to recur important spells. Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Vendilion Clique provide additional card advantage and disruption. The inclusion of Blood Moon can also disrupt opponent's mana bases, giving the deck an additional edge in certain matchups.
